channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023120921
item.description:
Report X-2023120921

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box were wet and brought to QA to be inspected by an admin. DescribePack: The container's cap wasn't fully on. It was lopsided. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was kept upright in a tote when it was processed. I fixed the cap and moved it into a drum.

item.title: Report X-2023120884
item.description:
Report X-2023120884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in Unload. Box was wet when retrieved. Package was taken and properly stored in the Hazmat Cage. DescribePack: Upon further investigation, two bottles of stain remover had loose caps and leaked within box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a Hazmat bin to prevent any other releases.

item.title: Report E-2023120451
item.description:
Report E-2023120451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: BIRDSBORO
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1/2 cup of sodium dichromate dihydrate (UN3288) released from a 50 lb paper bag due to improper packaging. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided that it would be cleaned by terminal staff using appropriate PPE. (1) 30gallon poly DF was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120895
item.description:
Report X-2023120895

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package came off trailer #568939 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of zep concentrated industrial purple degreaser. one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023121038
item.description:
Report X-2023121038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO IR2. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM. NO LIQUID ON THE ROLLER LINE NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023120927
item.description:
Report X-2023120927

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120927 SequenceEvent: a manager from the unload called out leaking hazmat. Brought over the red hazardous waste bin and my PPE to inspect. The package was not upright, brought it out of the trailer upright into the bin to be brought over to QA DescribePack: Loose cap, and wasn't upright. DurationRel: 22 and MitigateEffect: Kept the box and bottles upright to prevent anymore leaks. 2. X-2023120961 SequenceEvent: They called out leaking hazmat over the radio. Once I went over to the unload, I see the damaged hazmat on its side, actively leaking. Once I confirmed what type of hazmat it is, I put on proper PPE and moved the damaged hazmat into a red tote and brought it over to QA to have it processed. DescribePack: The box was soaking wet. There was no cap on the container that were leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was moved into a tote upright then moved into a sealed drum.

Report X-2023120937

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found on trailer number # 820473 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon's plastic bottles of denatured ethanol 1 gallon bottle had a loose cap allowing .5 gallon to release from bottle package had corrugate liner no absorbent, bags or slotted partitions was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1x1 gallon bottle of denatured ethanol had a loose cap allowing .5 gallon to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report I-2023120016
item.description:
Report I-2023120016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: WORCESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PROSPECT TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 3
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This incident was the result of a three (3) vehicle crash. Vehicle 1 was an auto which stopped in the right lane of the travel portion of the 70 MPH roadway blocking the right travel lane of the roadway. Vehicle 2 a truck stopped directly behind the auto or was in the process of coming to a halt to render assistance. Vehicle 3 consisting of a truck-tractor semi-trailer cargo tank in the right lane was unable to stop and made contact with vehicle 2 which made contact with vehicle 1. Vehicle 2 fuel tank exploded causing flames to engulf both vehicle 2 and the truck-tractor of vehicle 3. It appears that materials being transported in vehicle 2, including cylinders, exploded adding to the fire. Heat from the flames caused the Jet Fuel to build pressure causing release of the PRV and those vapors lit adding to the heat factor. Heat caused the right top portion of the cargo tank to melt releasing product onto the roadway which lit. Fire response units used foam to extinguish the tanker portion of the fire and water to handle the tire portion. Driver in Vehicle 3 along with driver and passenger in vehicle 2 died as a result of the flames. Driver Vehicle 1 was cited by PA State Police for causing the crash and issued several citations.
